abstract: Gangi Journal; Sicilian town of Gangi, which has suffered dwindling population over past century, is giving away or cheaply selling long abandoned houses in effort to revitalize economy; it has also streamlined bureaucracy involved in buying properties, though new owners are required to restore homes to habitability within four years; many of new owners are Sicilian, but offer has also attracted attention of vacation home seekers around world.
lead_paragraph: To reverse their town’s loss of population, residents of Gangi are offering houses for free or for nominal prices, provided that the new owners fix them.

headline.main: Sicilian Town Tells Outsiders: Take Our Homes. Please.
headline.print_headline: A Sicilian Town Is Giving Homes Away, but There’s a Catch

snippet: To reverse their town’s loss of population, residents of Gangi are offering houses for free or for nominal prices, provided that the new owners fix them.
